reportSections.title: Summary
reportSections.content: This report provides a comprehensive audit of the Stellar Contracts Library, version 0.1.0-RC. The analysis covers the scope, system overview, and a detailed breakdown of security issues.

reportSections.title: Scope
reportSections.content: The audit examined the OpenZeppelin/stellar-contracts repository at a specific commit. In-scope files include those within the token/fungible and pausable directories.

reportSections.title: Conclusion
reportSections.content: The audit concludes that while the Stellar Contracts Library is robust and well-documented, certain areas—particularly in security checks and macro handling—require further attention to ensure long-term reliability.

vulnerabilities.title: Missing event emissions
vulnerabilities.description: Contracts are missing event emissions for important state changes, such as owner/admin address updates, token address changes, and initialization.
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Consider emitting events in the functions where state changes occur.

vulnerabilities.title: Getter functions with @external visibility
vulnerabilities.description: Several functions declared as getters use the @external decorator despite not modifying state.
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Review function decorators and consider using @view for pure getters.

vulnerabilities.title: Improper access control in token minting
vulnerabilities.description: The token minting function lacks strict access control measures, potentially allowing unauthorized minting of tokens.
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Implement robust access control checks to restrict minting operations.

vulnerabilities.title: Inconsistent state validation
vulnerabilities.description: Some functions perform state validation inconsistently, which may lead to unexpected behaviors.
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Standardize state validation logic across all functions.

vulnerabilities.title: Inadequate error messages
vulnerabilities.description: Error messages in several parts of the contract are vague and do not provide sufficient context for debugging.
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Enhance error messages to be more descriptive and helpful for troubleshooting.

vulnerabilities.title: Potential reentrancy vulnerability
vulnerabilities.description: Certain external calls are unprotected, which could lead to reentrancy attacks if exploited.
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Introduce reentrancy guards and validate external calls appropriately.
